name: Edexia
headline: AI Teaching Assistant for Grading Papers
description:
Edexia is an AI teaching assistant that grades papers for teachers. It learns the style of each individual teacher, so it can grade just like they do, saving up to 100% of grading time.  
Edexia can grade assignments from any curriculum, year level, subject, or format. Learning like a teacher, it visually breaks down its understanding of the rubric, and updates this as a teacher corrects its grading on the fly. 
Our vision is to transform education by facilitating the safe and effective integration of AI across all institutions and applications. Not using AI to replace teachers but rather to empower them—providing them with all the time and resources they need to develop their students.
tags: industry:ai-enhanced-learning; industry:education; industry:saas; industry:ai; industry:ai-assistant; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Daniel Gibbon, Founder
founders.description: CEO at Edexia. On a mission to transform education. Scaled an EdTech startup to $200K ARR at 18 before founding Edexia. TEDx Speaker on AI in education. Ranked top 30 in my state out of high school. Switched from medical school to software engineering at UQ, achieving a perfect GPA.

founders.name: Nathan Wang, Founder
founders.description: on a mission to transform education!

generated_description:
### Edexia: Revolutionizing Grading with AI

**Overview**  
Edexia is an ambitious startup that aims to transform the education landscape by introducing an AI teaching assistant designed specifically for grading papers. Founded in 2023 in San Francisco and part of Y Combinator’s Batch W25, Edexia is a small but focused team of four who believe in empowering teachers, not replacing them.

**Mission**  
The core mission of Edexia is simple yet profound: to save teachers up to 100% of their grading time by learning their individual grading styles. The AI adapts to various curricula and subjects, making it versatile enough to grade everything from math and science to poetry and diagrams. The goal? Freeing up teachers from the mundane to focus more on student engagement and development.

**How It Works**  
Edexia’s AI doesn’t just churn out scores; it learns from each teacher’s unique rubric. As teachers provide corrections in real time, the system updates its understanding, ensuring that future grading aligns even more closely with the teacher's criteria. This dynamic learning process means that Edexia continuously improves, offering insights and analytics without ever compromising the teacher's control over final grades.

**Vision**  
The vision for Edexia extends beyond grading; it's about the safe and effective integration of AI in educational institutions. Edexia's leaders firmly believe that AI should support teachers, providing them with the tools and time to help their students thrive. This is a partnership model, where technology enhances rather than replaces human educators.

**Current Offerings**  
The platform is designed to handle both formative and summative assessments seamlessly. Whether grading complex essays or checking homework, Edexia ensures thoroughness while saving valuable hours for teachers. There’s even a free NAPLAN grader available to help schools get started.

**Security and Privacy**  
Data privacy is paramount at Edexia. They ensure that all training data is kept in silos to protect the privacy of individual educators and institutions. The platform is built with robust security measures, ensuring that user data remains confidential and secure.

**Conclusion**  
Edexia is paving the way for a future where AI and education go hand in hand—a future where teachers can enhance their teaching methods, engage more meaningfully with students, and manage their time more effectively. With backing from Y Combinator and a clear mission, Edexia is well-positioned to make a significant impact on the educational landscape.

For more information, visit their website: [Edexia](https://www.edexia.ai)
